timeline.bodyText:
Note that the semgrep-core accepts actually a float, so you can timeout at less than 1s, but then it's more complicated, you can't use alarm, you need to use a more specialized API (see semgrep-core/cli/Main.ml timeout function).
Note also that in semgrep-core the timeout is per processed file, not the full lenght of the program run.
Maybe you can add a comment that the int unit is in seconds.
